public class Player
extends Actor
The Player of the game.

  • Field Details

    • menu

      private final Menu menu
      Menu used for displaying the selections of actions the Player can choose from.

    • ecoPoints

      private int ecoPoints
      Stores the amount of eco points the Player has. Can be used to purchase Items at VendingMachine placed near spawn.

  • Constructor Details

    • Player

      public Player​(java.lang.String name, char displayChar, int hitPoints)
      Constructor.
      Parameters:
      name - Name to call the player in the UI
      displayChar - Character to represent the player in the UI
      hitPoints - Player's starting hitpoints

  • Method Details

    • canAfford

      public boolean canAfford​(int price)
      Check if the player can afford the price.
      Parameters:
      price - The price used to check against.
      Returns:
      True if the player can afford the price. False otherwise.

    • earnEcoPoints

      public void earnEcoPoints​(int amount)
      Increment player's eco points.
      Parameters:
      amount - Number of eco points to add to the Player.

    • spendEcoPoints

      public void spendEcoPoints​(int amount)
      Deduction of player's eco points when spending it.
      Parameters:
      amount - Number of eco points spent.

    • getCorpse

      public Corpse getCorpse()
      Returns the Player's Corpse. We assume Player is immortal as once he dies, the game ends. Therefore, the stats of Player's Corpse is set to 0, as it will not be used.
      Returns:
      The Player's Corpse

    • playTurn

      public Action playTurn​(Actions actions, Action lastAction, GameMap map, Display display)
      Select and return an action to perform on the current turn.
      Specified by:
      playTurn in class Actor
      Parameters:
      actions - Collection of possible actions
      lastAction - The Action the Player took last turn.
      map - The map containing the Actor
      display - The I/O object to which messages may be written
      Returns:
      The action to be performed by the Player this turn
